intro: Dissochaeta annulata var. griffithii, commonly known as the Griffith's threadleaf, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its compact growth habit and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species in its native habitat.
